babykitty1.description: Our neighbors just got a nice cat called Baby Kitty.  Here, Felix pretends to BE Baby Kitty. Baby Kitty herself just wants back in.
babykitty1.title: Babykitty 1

babykitty2.description: At first, Milo kept out of paw's reach because of his experiences with Nosy, the Joyce's trigger-happy feline.  That lasted maybe a day.
babykitty2.title: Babykitty 2

catboy1.description: Maria helps Milo put on Felix's cat costume.
catboy1.title: Catboy 1

catboy2.description: Many one- and two-year olds finds masks scary.  But not only does Milo like to wear this one, he guffawed the first time he saw Felix in it.
catboy2.title: Catboy 2

fourthstreet.description: We've been battered by storms since before Christmas.   This was the first sunny weekend in a good long while.   We got the heck outta the house.
fourthstreet.title: Fourthstreet

playground1.description: Does it take 2 or 3 Mosii to make a quorum?
playground1.title: Playground 1

playground2.description: Dean's letting his hair grow out.  His back hair is especially magnificent.
playground2.title: Playground 2

playground3.description: Milo loves a challenge.  This wet slide was really slick, but every time he slipped he just giggled at the misstep and kept on chuggin' until he gained the summit.
playground3.title: Playground 3

playground4.description: It's still rare that Felix and Milo are on the same play wavelength, but it is happening more and more.
playground4.title: Playground 4

playground5.description: Milo loves to be tickled, and LOVES attention from Felix.
playground5.title: Playground 5

playground6.description: The littlest Moses has the most infectious belly laugh.
playground6.title: Playground 6

spaceships1.description: It warms our hearts to see Felix and Milo playing together... well, if not together, at least companionably near each other.
spaceships1.title: Spaceships 1

spaceships2.description: What DID boys play with before spaceships and dinosaurs?
spaceships2.title: Spaceships 2

description:
Felix often pretends to be Keenan, who is 12. As Keenan, he pretends to do big kid stuff: watch scary movies (even making up a scary plot), read books (with no pictures!). He has Lucie or Dean pretend to be Felix, unable to do whatever big boy thing he's doing. Sometimes he has Milo be Nosy, the Joyce's cat, and tells the Felix stand-in to watch out for her claws.

Milo's adding more songs to his repertorire: the opening phrases of Trot Old Joe and Knick Knack Paddy Whack. Some songs he tries to say the words, others he just goes la-la-la or da-da-da. But he totally has the melodies.

Milo is obsessed with TV. He climbs on the couch and forcefully yells his program of choice: "Mimi" (Mimi the Mouse), "Po" (Teletubbies), or E-I-E-I-O (a DVD where chidren sing Old Mac Donald). When we refuse, he throws an absolute fit.
title: January 8
